name: bodega
content:

US a small shop that sells things that are often needed, especially one in an area of a US city where a lot of Latino people live (= people whose families originally come from Latin America): Around the neighbourhood, bodegas and groceries sit vacant.
a bar or wine shop, especially in Spain or a Spanish-speaking country: Try to visit a bodega, one of the large wine cellars to be found in towns and most villages.
More examplesFewer examplesThe neighbourhood grocery store, or bodega, is the centre of the community.Bodegas along the road offer tastings of the malvasia wine, which tastes like sherry.
